metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20237 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: An uncontrolled resource consumption (memory leak) flaw was found in ZeroMQ's src/xpub.cpp in versions before 4.3.3. This flaw allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to send crafted PUB messages that consume excessive memory if the CURVE/ZAP authentication is disabled on the server, causing a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

notes.Note: sespiros> Upstream patch introduces a regression which is addressed in https://github.com/zeromq/libzmq/pull/3959 (which fixes CVE-2021-20236)

criterions.comment: zeromq3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
